Question: What does a white diamond painted on the road mean?
Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
What do these road markings mean?

Answers.Answer: Turning vehicles should enter turning lane at arrows and avoid striped area
Turning vehicles should avoid all road markings and use the left-hand lane
All vehicles can make a U-turn at these road markings
Turning vehicles drive straight over all road markings and wait to turn right

Question: You can be fined if your vehicle is on a road and not up to warrant of fitness standard.
What is the maximum distance a load may overhang your vehicle behind the rear axle?
Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
A broken yellow line painted close to the edge of the road means you may stop or park your vehicle there at any time.
When coming up to a roundabout you must give way to all vehicles that will cross your path from your left.
Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
You are the driver of the blue car. Of the 4 hazards marked, which one is most likely to require you to take urgent action?
What does this sign mean?

Answers.Answer: You may park your vehicle within the next 40 metres of the sign
You may park your vehicle for no longer than 40 minutes from 8am to 6pm on days other than public holidays
You may park your vehicle for longer than 40 minutes if someone stays in it
You may not park your vehicle within the next 40 metres of the sign

Question: What should you do when you are coming up to traffic signals and the signals change from green to yellow?

Answers.Answer: Stop at the signals if you can do so safely
Speed up before the light changes to red
Stop even if it means stopping in the middle of the intersection
Turn hard to the left and stop around the corner

Question: You wish to move your vehicle out of a parking space into the traffic flow. What must you do before you move?

Answers.Answer: Flash your vehicle indicators for 1 second
Signal with your vehicle indicators for at least 3 seconds
Turn on your vehicle parking lights
Use your vehicle brake lights (stop lights)

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
The warrant of fitness label for your car should be displayed at the:

Answers.Answer: top right corner of the windscreen

Question: Alcohol slows down your reactions when driving.
When are you allowed to pass another vehicle?

Answers.Answer: When you are coming up to a blind corner or blind bend
When a vehicle has stopped at a pedestrian crossing
When you can see at least 100 metres of clear road in front of you once you have finished passing
When you are less than 10 metres away from a railway level crossing

Question: When driving on an unlaned road, where should your vehicle be positioned?

Answers.Answer: Anywhere, so long as you can see what is coming
Close to the centre of the road
As close to the left side of the road as possible

Question: What is shown by a white reflector (cat’s eye) placed on the road?

Answers.Answer: The left side of the road
The far right side of the road

Question: Your vehicle has a current warrant of fitness but a rear red brake light (stop light) is not working. What should you do?

Answers.Answer: Only use the vehicle during daylight hours
Only use the vehicle in a 50km/h speed zone

Question: You are turning right at traffic signals showing a red arrow pointing to the right. What should you do?

Answers.Answer: Drive on but give way to all oncoming vehicles
Stop and wait for a green arrow
Drive on straight ahead only if it is safe
Drive on because all oncoming vehicles are stopped

Question: What rule should you use to judge a safe following distance in wet or frosty conditions if driving a car?
What should you do if your vehicle breaks down on a motorway?

Answers.Answer: Lift up the bonnet and boot of your vehicle
Push your vehicle to the nearest off-ramp

Question: What does this sign mean?
A vehicle should not send out visible smoke for more than how many seconds?
You are waiting at a railway level crossing and the red lights continue to flash after the train has passed. What should you do?

Answers.Answer: Drive on carefully while the lights are still flashing
Stay stopped until the lights stop flashing
Check both ways and then drive on
Wait for 15 seconds and then drive on

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
If you have had a flat tyre and have fitted a ‘space saver wheel’ what must you do?

Answers.Answer: Drive directly to a place where the flat tyre can be repaired and replaced
Drive at 40km/h until the flat tyre has been repaired
Lower the pressure in the other tyres

Question: If you are the driver and hurt somebody in a crash, who must you report it to?
When coming up to a Stop sign, where should you stop?

Answers.Answer: With the front wheels of your vehicle on the yellow lines
With the rear wheels of your vehicle on the yellow lines
Where you can see all vehicles coming from all directions
Where you can only see vehicles coming from your right

Question: What is the safest way to carry goods inside a vehicle?

Answers.Answer: On the floor by the driver’s feet
On the shelf near the rear window

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
Passengers in your vehicle are 15 years or over. Who is responsible for making sure they wear a safety belt (seat belt)?

Answers.Answer: You as the driver of the vehicle

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
When traffic is merging, what is a good rule to follow?

Answers.Answer: Speed up to make room behind
Let one vehicle in and then go
Let two vehicles in and then go
